page.title: 05NE Nazeing
page.content: This part of Nazeing we covered was nearly all residential with a vast shortage of amenities. The only major thing other than houses and a few fields was a nursery. The houses, although monotonous, were nice and neat and clean-looking and had big gardens. There did not seem to be any shops apart from a tiny sweet shop/post office, so the residents must have to go a long way for their food. They were not too crowded together, and they had quite a bit of open space between them, and the occasional swing park as well. The people round about were in the main friendly, and helped me when I got lost. There seemed to be quite a nice little community going. I wouldn't mind living there (although I would prefer Harlow)
